import sys
sys.path.insert\(0, ''.''\)
from importlib import import_module

# Test imports
print\(''Testing imports...''\)
import json
import pika
import mysql.connector
print\(''  pika:'', pika.__version__\)
print\(''  mysql.connector:'', mysql.connector.__version__\)

# Test config loading
print\(''Testing config...''\)
import os
config_path = os.path.join\(''.'', ''guide-config.json''\)
with open\(config_path\) as f:
    cfg = json.load\(f\)
print\(''  Config loaded, keys:'', list\(cfg.keys\(\)\)[:5], ''...''\)

# Test RabbitMQ connection
print\(''Testing RabbitMQ...''\)
credentials = pika.PlainCredentials\(cfg.get\(''RABBITMQ_USER'', ''admin''\), cfg.get\(''RABBITMQ_PASSWORD'', ''admin123''\)\)
params = pika.ConnectionParameters\(
    host=cfg.get\(''RABBITMQ_HOST'', ''localhost''\),
    port=cfg.get\(''RABBITMQ_PORT'', 5692\),
    virtual_host=cfg.get\(''RABBITMQ_VHOST'', ''t16o_mq''\),
    credentials=credentials
\)
conn = pika.BlockingConnection\(params\)
channel = conn.channel\(\)
print\(''  Connected to RabbitMQ''\)

# Check queue
method = channel.queue_declare\(queue=''mq.guide.producer.request'', passive=True\)
print\(f''  producer.request queue: {method.method.message_count} messages''\)
conn.close\(\)
print\(''All OK''\)
")
